title: liandry's contradicts itself
body: why does liandry's have flat magic pen on it? with the burn doing current health dmg you would say liandry's is for doing dmg to tanks. But the flat magic pen is very effective vs squishy characters but the burn contradicts building it for that reason. if liandrys had a percentage pen on it it would actually fit the theme of tank busting. you could make the item like black cleaver so that hitting champs with more spells will give more percent pen on that target.

From what Xypherous mentioned a while back, the idea behind Liandry's is that it's meant to punish raw health-stacking, i.e. if you're a tank against someone with Liandry's, you _need_ to build MR, otherwise your health gets melted away. The implementation is not great, and the flat pen does give mages better burst against squishies, even though the item's DPS-based, so there's still a lot of confusion, but that much about it and tanks is intentional.

It's ironic that they'd claim that to be the purpose, when the AD counterpart is much, much, much better at doing the exact same thing. 

Liandry's doesn't scale, but BotRK does scale it's % dmg with atk speed, on top of having it's active. Which honestly, i've never seen a mage with Liandry's do significant damage because of it. Health stacking is still one of the most effective ways to nullify a mage, and armor still hardly does shit to stop marksmen and fighters.

I agree with this, BotRK scales at least with attack speed, whereas Liandry's doesn't scale with anything, aside from its arbitrary synergy with Rylai's. Neither BotRK nor Liandry's are in a particularly great state right now, but at least BotRK's effects still feel better to use.

To be honest, I feel the whole anti-health and anti-resistance systems in itemization are kinda messed up at this point. The existence of anti-health items like Liandry's and BotRK means _anyone_ can start ignoring a portion of the enemy's health, which forces either health items to give too much health in compensation, or those two items to be ineffective at their very niche, which is somewhat the case now. Similarly, armor/magic penetration means everyone gets to counter resistances to some degree, which inflates the values on armor and MR items. Basically, the very existence of items that counter existing counters to damage means that either tanky items need to give too many stats for tanks and fighters to survive, or those second-hand counter items need to be useless in order to not invalidate tanky champions. 

In the end, I think don't think any mage should be completely shut down by health- or MR-stacking, and the only mages who get to _really_ counter health are the ones designed for it, and should have the max health damage or pseudo-spellvamp to do so if they don't already. Basically, it would be better to have a League in which health, armor and MR could still counter damage, but never hard-counter it, and in which those stats weren't negated in large part by other items, which either give everyone access to tankbusting or end up being too weak to accomplish their goal, as is the case with Liandry's now.
